intro: Lechea corymbosa, commonly known as the clustered milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces milky sap, which is a distinguishing feature of the genus Lechea. Its leaves are typically alternate and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Lechea corymbosa is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
